SEARCH
Package menu

Class LoginMenu

java.lang.Object
menu.Menu
menu.LoginMenu
public class LoginMenu extends Menu
Represents the login menu where users can select their type, enter credentials, and log in. This class handles the login process, including user type selection, user authentication, and the appropriate menu for different user types.

The LoginMenu class extends Menu and implements the logic for the login process, including:

  • Prompting the user to select a user type.
  • Collecting the user ID and password for login.
  • Authenticating the user via the LoginService.
  • Redirecting to the appropriate menu based on the user type.
  • Handling special cases such as first-time login and password change.
See Also:

  • LoginService

  • Method Details

    • printMenu

      public void printMenu(User user)
      Prints the login menu for a given user. Since this method doesn't take in a user object, it's overridden to remain empty.
      Specified by:
      printMenu in class Menu
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose specific menu would be printed (not used in this method).

    • printMenu

      public void printMenu()
      Prints the general login menu and prompts the user for their user type, user ID, and password.

      After gathering user inputs, it authenticates the user and redirects them to the appropriate menu based on their user type. It also validates the user type selection and handles invalid input or system errors.

      Overrides:
      printMenu in class Menu

    • changePasswordPrompt

      public void changePasswordPrompt(User account)
      Prompts the user to change their password during the first login. This method repeatedly prompts the user for a new password until a valid password is provided.
      Parameters:
      account - the user account whose password is to be changed.
